SUSPICIOUS AND THRESHOLD TRANSACTIONS

Table of Contents

Failure to provide an IFTI report

 

Allsafe International Pty Ltd

On 9th February 2011, AUSTRAC issued a remedial direction against Allsafe International Pty Ltd ("Allsafe"), a Victorian foreign currency exchange business.

 

Allsafe was found to have breached a section of the AML/CTF Act requiring organisations to send a report to the AUSTRAC CEO on all international funds transfer instructions (IFTI) within ten days of either sending or receiving the instructions. Allsafe failed to provide the AUSTRAC CEO with the mandatory report.

 

Under the remedial direction, Allsafe was required to consult an AML expert on developing and implementing procedures to comply with its IFTI reporting obligations.

 

Organisations must report to AUSTRAC if they send or receive IFTIs and are one of the following:

 

•         Authorised deposit-taking institutions (ADI)

•         Registered providers of designated remittance services

•         Entities that sit between an institution that orders IFTIs and one that receives IFTIs

 

Reports must be submitted within 10 business days after the transaction is sent or received.

 

IFTI reports contain:

 

•         your organisation's details

•         the transfer instruction

•         parties involved in the transaction

•         the remittance service providers of the originating and destination countries

•         any additional information relating to the instruction

 

There are two types of IFTI reports: one for outward-bound/inward- bound IFTIs and one for designated remittance arrangements.

An international funds transfer instruction (IFTI) is an instruction to electronically transfer money into or out of Australia. The money could be transferred in Australian or foreign currency.

 

Types of IFTIs

 

Click on the terms below for more details

An IFTI is sent to an overseas financial institution.

An IFTI is received from an overseas financial institution.

Money is transferred overseas or into Australia outside the formal banking system.

Failure to provide an IFTI report
